CourseworkProjectsResearch

3D Stereoscopic Animations of Algebraic Surfaces Using Bertini_real and Blender/Python API

Faculty Mentor: Dr. Danielle Brake

May 2019 - Aug 2019

Technologies Used: Bertini_real, Python, Blender

Link: Repo

  • Created 3D movies rendered in stereoscopic anaglyph using Blender/Python API
  • Wrote automation shell script for video rendering of multiple surfaces
  • Integrated Bertini_real and Blender via Python for automation of routine tasks, such as setting up camera path, object properties, animations and lighting

 

 

Visualization of Algebraic Surfaces Using Python and Bertini_real

Faculty Mentor: Dr. Danielle Brake

Sep 2018 - May 2019

Technologies Used: Bertini_real, Python, 3D Builder, Blender, Simplify3D, Sphinx, LaTeX - for research poster

Link: Repo

  • Collaborated with Dan Hessler (research student) and contributed to an open-source software, Bertini_real by implementing python-based visualization routine
  • Translated raw surface visualization operation from MATLAB to Python
  • Implemented codes of operations for stereolithography (STL) mesh export feature for 3d printing
  • Used Sphinx to auto-document Python source codes and created tutorials on how to use the software Python visualization suite
  • Presented poster at National Conferences on Undergraduate Research (NCUR2019) in Kennessaw Georgia and UW System Symposium in Green Bay

** I do not own the copyrights to the images. Danielle owns them :)

 

 

Random Forest Analysis of Breast Cancer Age at Onset

Faculty Mentor: Dr. Abra Brisbin

Sep 2018 - May 2019

Technologies Used: R, RStudio, Excel, Plink, Blugold Supercomputing Cluster (BGSC) - for random forest analysis of real genetic dataset which is around 47,000 Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs), Slurm

  • Implemented a two-phased approach: [1] ordinal logistic regression & [2] random forest to identify additional genetic variants for binned age at onset traits
  • Divided real data on breast cancer into 8 different chromosomes ubsets and scheduled each random forest analysis jobs on BGSC through Slurm
  • Collaborated with Hannah Bettack (research student) and presented a talk during annual Math Retreat & poster at UW System Symposium

 

 

3D Printing Herwig Hauser’s Gallery of Algebraic Surfaces with Bertini_real

Faculty Mentor: Dr. Danielle Brake

Sep 2017 - May 2018

Technologies Used: Bertini_real, MATLAB, 3D Builder, Blender, Simplify3D, LaTeX, Ultibots D300VS, LulzBot TAZ (3D printers), PLA filament

  • Learned how to use an open-source numerical software, Bertini_real to compute algebraic surfaces from Herwig Hauser Gallery
  • Solidified algebraic surfaces with singularities via Blender
  • Added support, configured printing process & 3D printed several mathematical models such as Kreuz, Tobel, Stern, Croissant, and etc through Simplify3D
  • Presented a talk at the Society of Industrial and Mathematics Annual Meeting 2018 (SIAM AN18) in Portland, Oregon.
  • Collaborated and presented poster with David Bachmeier (research student) at UWEC CERCA

** I do not own the copyrights to the images. Danielle owns them :)
